website_summaries.verdict: The best value for your money. A moderately priced steamer with many useful features.
pros: Water tank provides 45 to 55 minutes of steam time
cons: Occasional durability complaints after two or more years of use

customer_reviews.title: Good steamer, gets the job done, great for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this steamer after moving out with my roommate. She had another steamer that was higher quality, but also a higher price. You could tell that this one (priced about half of hers) was a little less durable and would tip over if you hit it with a good amount of force. That being said, this is a quality steamer that gets your wrinkles out of your clothes without hassle. It heats up fast and puts out a good amount of steam. I would recommend this product if you want a quality Steamer in your price point. I would probably spend the extra money for a nicer one with a bigger base next time.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor J.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The steamer appears well made and sturdy. But the steamer keeps moving. You need one hand to hold the stem, one hand to ply the steamer wand and need a third one to hold the dress!! Too bad I have only two hands! Secondly, the steamer wand needs a trigger to release/stop the steam. Otherwise a lot of the steam gets wasted switching clothes.
customer_reviews.author: kayceefan2000

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!1
customer_reviews.text: I thought I actually posted this review in July - It tips over when you hang anything on it. The hose is too short. There was barely any steam that came from it. I tried it for the 3rd time and I get nothing from it. Each time I used it I emptied all the water out of it and I also used distilled water. I finally bought a Sunbeam - What a difference. I should have purchased that one from the beginning. I only hope I can return this one. It's awful!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn P

customer_reviews.title: Awkward and leaky. Travel steamer is a much better product.
customer_reviews.text: Just to cut to the chase; opt for the steam fast travel steamer instead. Works 10x better, costs less, and stores easily. I was really excited about this steamer, unfortunately it is a terribly designed product. It isn't balanced correctly so it tips over a lot. The hose drips badly, leaving huge wet spots on clothing. Steam is inconsistent and sputtered. My sister in law bought me the steam fast travel steamer... It blows this one away. Just an fyi... If you think (like I did) that a steamer can replace an iron, sadly it won't... Very sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Jan R.

customer_reviews.title: Decent steamer at a reasonable price point
customer_reviews.text: I loved this thing while it worked, but after about 5 or 6 months is started leaking water from the base even though I kept it in one place and didn't move it around almost at all. It did continue to function, however and did a great job of steaming my clothes. It holds a good amount of water so you don't have to run back and forth refilling it just to get a couple of shirts done. I had it for about two years before it stopped working completely. At $50 I suppose that's not a bad life.
customer_reviews.author: options.BatchSize

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself after a month of use, no more dry cleaning or pressing!
customer_reviews.text: Use this every week. Recommend that you use distilled water. I used tap and sediment built up in the water area. Easy to clean out if this problem arises. Bought this instead of the smaller hand held one. Has paid for itself very quickly. Used to take my mens dress shirts into the dry cleaner to press every week ($2/ shirt) and it was getting expensive. Tried to iron my shirts but failed miserably. This steamer is very easy to use and steams my shirts flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy! It has been 33 days since the purchase, and 30 days since received and open. Unfortunately Amazon does not allow returns over 30days, but this steamer does not work. I have never rated anything 1 star, and would do 0 stars if I could. Do not buy this, and definitely not through Amazon. Maybe in store because then when/if it stops working something can be done. $55 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to say I love anything that has to do with ironing but I am very happy with this. It definitely takes out the wrinkles and heats up super fast. I've not noticed any dripping or leakage and it is stable enough to hang multiple shirts on as you're finished steaming. It's been a very nice tool and has saved me lots of time. My problem, hence the 4 stars, is that I burn myself easily when trying to hold the corners of the clothing to get them straightened. I wish there were a way to shut off the steam temporarily or something to hold the clothing in place for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya A. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: A good unit.
customer_reviews.text: If this was just for cloths I would give it a 5 star rateing. I needed something to put out more continous or longer heat before it cycles again. It did a fantastic job and would be perfect for cloths, but I was using it for bed bugs. I might be expecting too much but over all I was happy. A week point is where the hose connects to the tank. If you move the unit it is likely to break the fitting.
customer_reviews.author: The Count

customer_reviews.title: This thing is so great. Discovering steamers was amazing - they are SO ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so great. Discovering steamers was amazing - they are SO MUCH better than ironing. (I always seem to iron more wrinkles into my clothes than I get out). I only dislike the fact that unless you steam out every drop of water (which is pretty impossible to do and risks damaging the machine), it is super awkward trying to dump out the remaining water from the bottom portion. When I first got the steamer, this portion was full of dirt as well. All in all I'm willing to overlook these things though because the steamer makes life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha S

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this a year and a half ago and loved it, used it at least once a week, usually more. Kept it clean, dry, etc. and this week it just stopped making enough steam to actually unwrinkle clothes. So I pull up my warrnety so upset that it’s broken and it hasn’t even been two years, and what do you know it’s only a one year warranty. It’s almost as if they know it will last a year and probably break after that. Spend a little more money and buy a better quality steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: !!!Don't buy!!! As an architect I can appreciate build quality and good design. This piece of junk has nothing going for it.. The first day I got it I tried it out and the telescoping rod fell apart. I had to use duct tape to keep it in place. The hose is way too short and you have to empty the water tank with each use. I spent an hour with it and immediately ordered a Jiffy. A Jiffy is worth the extra $100 - you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D. Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 15 months
customer_reviews.text: I love this product but after 15 months it just stopped working! The listing says 2 year hassle free guarantee, but I can’t find any way to contact the company to discuss a solution. I will gladly change my rating if I am contacted to rectify this situation as I really enjoy this steamer and use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Zlo3d2

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steamer more than four years ago now, so it is durable, I'll give it that. However, I moved recently and the steamer is now sitting on hardwood floor, and I realized that it leaks consistently when I use it. Obviously when it's sitting on hardwood this is a problem. It's possible that the leaking is due to age, and it works well enough otherwise, but the leaking is a major issue for me. Will be purchasing a new, different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Grinman

customer_reviews.title: Steam comes out in bursts, not steady stream. very frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Having worked in retail for 10 years I use a steamer to get wrinkles out of clothes because it's fast, refreshes clothes, and so easy. No more ironing for me. I got this steamer and its really not reliable. Set it up, filled the tank with water and was really frustrated. Steam comes out in bursts, then stops and slows down so it's not effective. I tried shaking the unit, tried moving the hose around, which helps. It shouldn't be that hard to get consistent steam to come out. Its frustrating because you really don't know how these items work until you purchase it, and it would be a huge pain to return.
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: They redid the design on this and covered the hose ...
customer_reviews.text: They redid the design on this and covered the hose in a thick roped fabric, probably to be more safe but it makes it slightly more difficult to use and you have to make sure to hold the hose out straight or it gets clogged. But it still has the kick I need to get those wrinkles out. The smaller, hand held ones just don’t cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Sunderland

customer_reviews.title: I think it is better than a hot iron.
customer_reviews.text: I like this steamer because I can steam several pieces of clothing at one time before needing to refill the water reservoir. I also use it in conjunction with a hand held steamer to do slacks for a hard press. I love the steamer method of doing my clothing I think it is better than a hot iron.
customer_reviews.author: MISSISSIPPI QUEEN

customer_reviews.title: This particular one is my second one that I bought because I traveled and my other better one was left in storage
customer_reviews.text: I threw away my iron once I bought a Steamer b/c its so much easier to straighten clothing. This particular one is my second one that I bought because I traveled and my other better one was left in storage. I would still recommend this one b/c it did do it's job really well and the amount of delay for the heat was not much in between some times. Its also a good small size where you can take it along with you if your doing a function that requires you to steam. I would stay away from any small portable hand steamers though like the ones that fit in a girls medium purse, but to each their own.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DragonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this steamer for 2 years and it had worked well, it starts steaming fast and it does a good job. The pole where you hang the clothes is a little flimsy. What I hate about it it’s that it just stopped working all together. The blue light goes on but nothing happens.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Costa

customer_reviews.title: Fast, convenient, PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: I have had this steamer for almost 2 months, and I am LOVING IT. It performs exactly as promised. Small, clean design, easy to put together, 1 button function. It heats up within 30 seconds of being turned on, and steams clothes beautifully. I spent weeks looking for the perfect steamer after my old one busted. If you've used a steamer before, you understand how you could never go back to using a conventional iron; if you've never owned a clothes steamer, this is the one to buy! You'll thank yourself for the investment, trust me.
customer_reviews.author: PT

customer_reviews.title: Serious Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Major design flaw. The telescopic pole is too short, the hose is too short, and it tips over. This is my experience: Tried to use the telescopic pole to hang the shirt but when I would pull out the front of the shirt to get the steamer inside, the steamer started to tip over. Obviously that's not a good thing. I then tried to hang the shirt on the back of a door but then the hose was too short to reach the collar. It's just a headache. Definite design flaw. I'm returning it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Belarusa

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the closet
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good steamer, but Not very sturdy. And does a good job for some type of clothes. If it’s a wrinkled cotton then you will likely need to do something else. But any polyester or synthetic clothes works amazing.
customer_reviews.author: YuliaV

customer_reviews.title: Quality but lacking quality as expected
customer_reviews.text: Great for what it is. Takes getting a hang of. Burn myself a little. Dress pants are a bigger pain than dress shirts. Not the best for the most formal wear, but good for going out clothes, and sometimes for business casual work clothes. Maybe I'll master it eventually & it'll be good for formal wear. I'm horrible at ironing... The hanging rod obviously isn't very sturdy. The little hand pad that comes with it is clutch. The brush on the end of the steam hose is effective at collecting most hair & lint. As a young professional, I say it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: L. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix
customer_reviews.text: Although it stopped working due to blockage, I was able to fix the problem by opening up the machine and removing the debris thanks a previous reviewer photos and it’s again like new! The motor never stopped working. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Upper East Side buyer

customer_reviews.title: This steamer tank is compact and the unit is easy to move around
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of Steamfast and after reading other reviews purchased this for our elderly mom who has difficulty ironing and did not want to leave the ironing board up 24/7. This steamer tank is compact and the unit is easy to move around. There are other steamers that will hold more water but this little steamer heats up fast and we were able to steam 10 shirts with one tank of water.
customer_reviews.author: Explore With Dana

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and ready to use in under ...
customer_reviews.text: This steamer came really well packaged. It was easy to set up and ready to use in under a minute! It comes with a removable brush end that I prefer to do without, because I find that it's more efficient that way. The stand is adjustable and has a hook at the end where you can place your item of clothing to be steamed on a hanger. It also has wheels on the base that make it super easy to move around. My only issue with it is that the wheels don't have any type of breaking mechanism to keep the unit in place, but I resolved this easily by placing it on a carpeted area.
customer_reviews.author: ayat

customer_reviews.title: Works great but know you will be replacing eventually
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I've purchased. They last about 2 to 3 years and then they corrode up and stop working. You just need to know going in that you'll be buying another eventually but they work fine for the time they work. If you used distilled water you might get longer but who has distilled water handy? Just tap water and plan to get another one in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Luv2troll4fish

customer_reviews.title: Steams well, but pipe gets hot
customer_reviews.text: The pipe is not insulated well enough, so it gets very hot. Edit: this product is poorly manufactured. Many components get too hot while you're using it, so it's possible to burn yourself. The pipe is also unwieldy, in part due to the aforementioned heat issues, and in part because it's too stiff. The water container's mouth features a nifty design that stops the water from spilling out when you turn it over to fasten it into the machine, but is flimsy and is prone to breakage. I'd shop around for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works!
customer_reviews.text: I am not someone who had bought very many steamers. Nor did I ever work in retail where I had experience using them. My opinion is based solely on my use of the product. I use this device on t-shirts and light fabric items that had become wrinkled from being stored unfolded. For this, it works great! All of my shirts look very sharp and any smells from the item are wiped out. It does not work well on heavy fabric, like pants. It also does not work well on dress shirts that were washed and not properly ironed. It will not replace the standard iron from these items, but it is very useful in other situations.
customer_reviews.author: Jokoo

customer_reviews.title: It works great for my wife she uses it daily for her ...
customer_reviews.text: It works great for my wife she uses it daily for her work clothes (mostly polyester stuff) If you have extremely wrinkled cotton items it will help but not much. IS great on suits and dress slacks. I like the product and i think it works well, make sure you use distilled water and not regular tap water for best use. UPDATE 11/5/2015 Nothings changed had this for over a year and still works like new good product that is used daily.
customer_reviews.author: rquiles

customer_reviews.title: Don't use it that much anymore
customer_reviews.text: I got this to steam linens that I have for my destination wedding business. I really didn't find it that helpful. It's ok for light shirts, etc, but I have to fall back to an iron to really get wrinkles out. I do like the extension on it so that I can stand while steaming and it's light and convenient to roll around - but I don't use it that much anymore. When I bought this, I also bought a Steamfast SF-435 Fabric Steamer (hand steamer) to have on hand for bridal parties to use. I find I use that a lot more and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: My-StCroix

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for a couple years
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for a couple years, but this is not a durable product. There are big black pieces of plastic (I assume from the inside of the tube) that keep appearing in the water tank area when the tank is removed and you rinse it out. The water tank is also brown now, with some funky looking pieces. My hunch is that this product may be designed fine for periodic use and if you are a perfect consumer, but for most of us, you'll get two years out of it and need a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Meggy Wire

customer_reviews.title: It's okay~
customer_reviews.text: First time owning a steamer....it works...but only on light wrinkles. It's more for touch-ups post ironing....I still use my iron, but on the lazy days or when I need my cloth done asap, I would use this steamer... Was going to give it a 3 star....but after writing the review I realized to myself that it was never meant to replace the iron, wouldn't be fair to give it only 3..... 4 stars...would recommend other to learn more about steamers before buying one. For the delicate cloths, this works wonder!
customer_reviews.author: Zukake Monoko

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is an excellent product. I wouldn't consider using the iron in ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted one and although I was skeptical, I've come around. For the price this is an excellent product. I wouldn't consider using the iron in my rushed morning before work but found myself using this. It's quick and actually more convenient and compact than an iron and board. While the ironing board is in the basement this is conveniently located in the spare bedroom upstairs where it gets more use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Hose Is Stiff and Does Not Move Easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a significant downgrade from a previous model I had of theirs. The hose is hard to handle and restricts movement. The tank is very, very small, so if you have quite a bit of things to do...This will konk out on you. I purchased this because my other one broke during a move and I did not open the box for 40 days...feeling for sure I had a great product. I will not use this. I am really disappointed and stuck with a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Green

customer_reviews.title: POORLY DESIGNED AND VERY DANGEROUS.
customer_reviews.text: This product should be removed from the market. It is extremly dangerous. A slight nudge will make the whole thing fall over on you while it is on. There is no failsafe mechanism. Also the hose that transports the steam gets dangerously hot. The machine does not work well on anything heavier then a tissue. I wish I could return it but it is past the date. I have never been so disappointed in a product ordered from Amazon. DO NOT USE THIS PRODUCT WITH CHILDREN AROUND YOU!!! This is a liability suit just waiting to happen.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleReign

customer_reviews.title: This is my second steamer. This one is very ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second steamer. This one is very light, appears quite flimsy and the hose that carries all the steam is not insulated so if you touch it or rub against it, there is a possibility of gettig burned. I have to confess that I'm not too impressed, but it is working as it should, so I'll wait and see how long it lasts. I learned by lesson from my old steamer so this time I'm using distrilled water and will clean regularly with white vinegar.
customer_reviews.author: R N M

customer_reviews.title: Hose gets too hot!
customer_reviews.text: I love steamers- so much faster than ironing. However, this is my least favorite steamer yet. The hose gets so hot that if it touches your skin, it is uncomfortable and has the potential of burning your skin. Also, the hose is awkward to work with because it's shorter than I would've liked and very rigid. Yes, high amounts of steam come from the steamer and onto my clothes, but because of the awkward, inflexibile, and extremely hot hose (when compared to other manufacturer's products), I would go with another brand, personally.
customer_reviews.author: Syd39

customer_reviews.title: There are better fabric steamers out there for better price
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me from day one of purchase. Steam does not flow out consistently. At times, there was no steam if not held in a particular position. I used deionized water but still ended up with black and gray deposits in the steamer. The steam that it sputters out is not strong enough for cotton or linen. Not sure if I got a bad unit because I purchased it based on the positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Glee

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy Used Product
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived in a very damaged box, poorly packaged with a few pieces of crumbled newspaper. Item was dirty and missing items including the stand. Item appeared to have used for a very long time and not suitable for a donation to local Goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: The product stopped working after 16 months and the company will not issue a new device, even though there is a 2 year warranty. They stated the model was older than 2 years, and therefore not under warranty. The steamer itself worked well for the first year. A little disappointing because a few reviews I read warned that the product did not last a long time. I should have taken this into consideration before buying.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Pennella

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend. Steams up quickly and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: For the price I was hoping for something a bit larger, however it's still very solid. Would definitely recommend. Steams up quickly and gets the job done. The hose connecting the base to the steamer head could stand to be longer... however that could go for most Steamers. Great product, fast delivery and no hassle assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: using it like an ironing board
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Knew going in that I would just keep an eye on the water level due to the smaller unit's tank size. General tip for steaming curtains - Found steaming curtains difficult until I got the idea to place a sheet of styrafoam behind, using it like an ironing board. Made the work a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient and well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of other reviews and I'm not at all disappointed. Just as others mentioned, it heats super fast, and the wide head and large holes make steaming out wrinkles happen quickly with one pass. I owned another steamer before and this works faster and doesn't spit up water. I also love the convenient removable water pitcher. The only con so far (I've owned it for a few months): you will need to buy or use another stand for hanging your clothes as you steam for the one on the steamer is far too short and really seems meant for hanging the steamer head only. Otherwise, wonderful! Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Bliss Om

customer_reviews.title: Really was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading great reviews, I wanted to make my life easier with this fabric steamer. My unit definitely did not perform like the ones everybody raved about. Took the care to steam a shirt for about 20 min. The work shirt for my husband was still wrinkled. We tried this on the day we received and found it to be MUCH less efficient than ironing a shirt. My husband helped me pack the unit up and arranged for a return ad "Not performing as advertised." I usually don't write negative comments, but this one, I had to :(
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Low quality plastic, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic parts is not very well-made. The material quality is not the highest, and some parts cannot align with others perfectly, such as the brush. I hope the head could be metal instead of plastic. The material of the water reservoir is also not very good, so it' snot heavy duty. However, it works well. It's my first time to use this kind of steamer, and it works much faster than traditional ones. It's very convenient. But I cannot adjust temperature, so the only way is to adjust the distance to fabrics. Installation is easy, and the step-by-step manual explains clearly.
customer_reviews.author: MQ

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than ironing
customer_reviews.text: Works great, much faster than ironing. This thing is awesome. It has saved me a lot of time steaming my shirts instead of ironing them.
customer_reviews.author: Sea

customer_reviews.title: Sending right back
customer_reviews.text: Waited over half an hour and steam still never came out. Had filled water With distilled water as directed. Heated up hose was also very hot but steam never came out.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for years, and although it works, and does heat up very quickly, it's not perfect. It tends to drip a lot (from the steam head, it doesn't actually leak anywhere), it tips over very easily (poorly or not-at-all weighted in the base), and the extending pole is just a bit too short to actually be practical for hanging gowns on. Still, I haven't replaced it with a pricer model because in the end, it does do a good job steaming, even if it's not perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: works well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This was a addition to my wardrobe room. It's perfect my clothes are always wrinkle free. Just remember to always use distilled water to keep the machine working well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working for me after maybe a dozen uses. It will release steam for about a minute and then stop for another. I tried refilling with water (in case there was a blockage and water wan't entering the system) and making sure there were no kinks in the hose, but it still sucks. So unless you don't mind waiting around for the steamer to finally release steam for maybe 30 seconds at a time, don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Katy Geither

customer_reviews.title: It works very well. It works very well
customer_reviews.text: After ironing a few shirts, it works very well and has obvious effects. I like all the colors and styles for my daily household. All the small appliances are Supor's. Really worth having, had it to be not afraid of clothes wrinkly of, otherwise take outside ironing to somebody else, much inconvenient! Generally speaking, the effect is quite good. If you need to buy an ironing machine, you can choose this one.
customer_reviews.author: Yulia Martens

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS STEAMER!!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments I've ever made! I bought this steamer for our curtains around our entire house, when we moved into a new construction home. This little steamer is perfect -doesn't leak water, and steams for almost an hour at a time. It works on lots of different materials and we plan to use it on our suites so we save money. We also talked about using it around the house to kill germs when our kids are sick.. steaming the furniture and hard to wash blankets. I would highly recommend this steamer to anyone!!! Awesome little machine. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mamabb18Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it, just use an iron
customer_reviews.text: I tried to get this to replace my iron but it didn't work very well at all. It was able to get basic wrinkles out of clothes, but once anything heavy duty came up, I had to get my iron out instead. Not a complete waste of money but only useful for certain situations.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Steams beautifully, but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this steamer in August of 2011. I love how easy it is to steam the wrinkles out of clothes. However, in the past month the hose connector broke into 3 pieces. I looked for replacement parts online, but came up empty. We used a tape that withstands heat to tape it back on. Last night, I took the cap of the water canister and the cap, plunger and all broke to pieces in my hand. So now, beings I cannot find replacement parts, it goes in the trash. I will buy another steamer, just not this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsylou

customer_reviews.title: Cord too short.
customer_reviews.text: Cord is too short. But it works fine on most fabrics. Tough cotton fabric not too well, especially if in a rush, but ok, you need to take your time to do 6 pass for a decent finish.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little steamer for the price! Used it for the first time last night and it worked like a champ! Does spit out water sometimes so be careful of your hand placement, but for the price I couldn't have asked for more. Doesn't tip over too easily like some other cheaper ones.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this steamer for several months now and I love it! It works great, does not have issues with condensation and spurting out water on your clothes like other steamers. My ONLY complaint, which isn't that big of a deal, is that the hose gets really hot during use, hot enough that you can't hold the plastic part of the hose (which you don't really have to hold on to in order to use, but sometimes you can forget grab it in order to maneuver it around). Overall, definitely worth the money and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Galina

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I'll start off by saying that I've never used an industrial version, as some commentators have, and so have little to compare my experience with this fabric steamer to. That said it sets up very easily, it turns water to steam quickly, and melts away the wrinkles. The stand could be taller for clothing, which is enough to knock off half a star if they allowed half increments here, but I would rather keep it at 5 than at 4 because it otherwise met my expectations to the letter. Good packing. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Missing part!
customer_reviews.text: I was quite excited to get this product but when I received it it was missing the pole stand to hold my clothes. Which is quite annoying because the product itself works quite well but tinge fact that the main thing I bought it for wasn’t there was quite frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: binh

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Love the tiny size...fits behind a bedroom door very easily and discreetly. Works very well. Heats quickly. No leaks
customer_reviews.author: NAC

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I got the full size model instead of the hand held option. I ended up needing a lot more time that I thought and this guy can last for 45 min on one tank of water. It heats up really quickly and has a convenient place to hang your clothes while you steam. My only issue is that you need to be mindful of the hose not creasing or the steam stops. Other than that I am really happy with this product. I've used it on all my items in my etsy shop "StyleNarkVintage" check it out
customer_reviews.author: J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product works great on clothes, gets wrinkles out with little effort. One of the problems I have with this steamer is the length of the hose. The hose is not long enough to steam curtains but if you don't steam anything but clothes then I would recommend this product to you. Second problem is with the brush attachment, it is cheaply made and doesn't stay on the nozzle. Othe than the to problems mentioned above everything else works great. One other thing be careful when using this steamer because the hose gets really hot and I brushed my leg against it and it burned me.
customer_reviews.author: Cole Night Trane

customer_reviews.title: Would not be without
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a larger unit different brand. Thought I would be unhappy but quite the contrary I am so excited with this produce. I is smaller and takes up far less room. Does an even better job than the larger one I had.
customer_reviews.author: greeneyes

customer_reviews.title: move over stanley steamer....
customer_reviews.text: steams well like any other. and like any other steamer make sure you don't leave water in it and clean out the mineral deposits from your water. or unless you use purified water to steam it. steams up fast, works well, light and easy and go for a good half hour to 45 minutes of steaming clothes. and you can't beat the price. yes a rowenta is better quality... if you are looking for a hand held but this works just fine as a full stand up.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy S

customer_reviews.title: Ironing is never fun and well steaming isn't really fun either
customer_reviews.text: Ironing is never fun and well steaming isn't really fun either. However, I feel like steaming is 3 times as fast as ironing but 80 percent as effective. That said, this model steamer is pretty easy to use and starts steaming pretty quickly. The hose is not too thick and can get pretty hot. As long as youre careful with the heat, this thing is pretty money. It won't replace an iron for getting those sharp creases but for everything else...its pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: laal

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got tired of spending tons of money and time having my dresses dry cleaned every two weeks, so I headed to the Internet to do some research on clothing steamers. After a couple hours of reading reviews, I settled on this one! So far it's worked fabulously on all of my clothes, and even drapes and chairs! The only downside is I wish the pole on which you hang the garment on expanded to be taller.
customer_reviews.author: Jennuhhhhh

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love my new steamer.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this steamer. I plan to use distilled water to make sure it stays clean. It heats up fast, it stays hot, it complains a bit when the handle is used upside down but it still steams out the wrinkles. I bought a Tobi many years ago for 110.00 to much money, but that's how much steamers where selling for back then, so you can imagine how happy I was to pay half of that and it works even better. Easy to put together. Pole not to tall but no complains.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci

customer_reviews.title: Steamer works great. The hose does not seem to move around ...
customer_reviews.text: Steamer works great. The hose does not seem to move around too easily though until after the steamer is turned on and gets hot. Once ready heated up, it is easy to use. I took the brushes off the wand nozzle because I use it for delicate blouses. Works better for me without the clip on brush. Much better than using an iron for delicate clothing. Steam stops coming out sometimes and I have to hold the handle up and then all the way down and back up to allow th steam to travel through the hose. Still a very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: ... product for about a year now and I do love it. It works better than the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this product for about a year now and I do love it. It works better than the one I bought from Macys and has done as I would expect a stand up fabric steamer would. However it is not perfect as the parts it uses are at some points flimsy making it somewhat weak and hard to use at times but overall this fits as a quick fabric steaming solution.
customer_reviews.author: William Sung

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned various steamers, some cost three times more than this one and I must state this is the best of the bunch! It's ready to go in 30 seconds and doesn't require multiple passes to take wrinkles out of my curtains or lightweight shirts and slacks. Best of all I don't have to drag out my ironing board anymore! As for storage this steamer takes up very little space in my linen closet. LOVE THIS! Why only 4stars? I wish it had a bigger water capacity esp for when I'm doing really big jobs like steaming the 35 curtians hanging around my house that I wash every 4months.
customer_reviews.author: Tech junkie 2

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: Broken after not even a year. I thought it was maybe just build-up, but I’ve descaled with vinegar solution multiple times and the power does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Brown

customer_reviews.title: Though the price is lower, it does not take away from performance.
customer_reviews.text: Tried this out last night. As first it took a while to get the steam going and I even considered returning... but once it was really ready, it worked just great. Happy with this product for the price and the product. Will be keeping for sure!
customer_reviews.author: palmcoaster

customer_reviews.title: Heats up fast, removes wrinkles easily.
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is the bomb! I needed something like this to steam the wrinkles out of my furniture covers and this does the job. The wheels make it easy to maneuver. Heats up as quickly as documentation says it does and the steam is continuous. Great value, great product.
customer_reviews.author: P. English

customer_reviews.title: steam was very poor.
customer_reviews.text: It was defective not producing enough steam. I tried it for a couple of days and no matter what I did or how long I waited the steam was very poor. I am returning and trying a different one.
customer_reviews.author: manuel rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is very simple to set up and, it does a swell job of steaming wrinkles and the wheels help to prevent it tipping over. My only complaints are: 1) The rubber hose gets extremely hot, it should have a woven fabric outer covering like other steamers come with. 2) The stationary unit could use a handle at the rear in order to make it easier to pick up and store. 3) The removable water tank needs a handle or better grips to be able to remove it and drain or clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: I suppose it's better than no steamer at all
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it's better than no steamer at all, but I was disappointed that instructions called for an inside-out approach for best results. Considering that I bought it mainly for heavy curtains and dust-ruffles, the inside-out method is far from easy, and the surface steaming takes forever to smooth out wrinkles. It's not bad for blouses (inside-out steaming), but don't count on the crisp look regular ironing provides.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Garneau

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every wardrobe.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the BEST investment I've ever made. No more ironing!!! Whether you need a quick freshening of a garment or you need to put a crease into slacks or jeans...this product won't disappoint. Side note....ALWAYS USE DISTILLED WATER...and always empty the water completely after each and every use. Tap water will clog the unit. Simple cleaning instructions...follow them to the "T" and your unit will last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: T Marie

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.text: i have only owned this since 12-2016 and it no longer will turn on, I barely used this steamer, I kept it clean very disappointing. Its only 6-2019 IT SHOULD OF LASTED LONGER THAN IT DID FOR THE AMOUNT I PAID UGH
customer_reviews.author: jennifer ewing

customer_reviews.title: Solid steamer
customer_reviews.text: It worked really well at my newer apartment but when I moved to an old apartment building it tripped the fuse and didn’t recover. So people in old buildings be ware. It streams well and has a nice large reservoir. It did not leak either which is nice. It will tip over if you do not balance your clothes and put something heavy on there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware: you may not receive everything they advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The streamer itself is ok. The reason I gave it 1 star is because it doesn't come with press pad (that it advertised in the description). Without the press pad, some area are difficult to get rid of the wrinkles. The stream last about half an hour. To prevent clog in the product, we are supposed to get all the remaining (unused) water out after finish streaming. However, It's so difficult to do so with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I searched for a long time before deciding on this seamer. I keep it in my walk-in. closet. It does not leak and heats up within a minute or less. It is solid and does not tip when clothes are hung on the bar. I think it is fantastic and well built. It works even better than I had hoped in removing wrinkles from my work clothes! I highly recommend this steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Girl

customer_reviews.title: This is a decent steamer. Gets the job done ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent steamer. Gets the job done. A little unstable (low quality components). Works well on light wrinkles. Stubborn wrinkles take quite a while, but you can eventually get 'em out if you steam for 15+ minutes.
customer_reviews.author: BoHux

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST ADULT PURCHASE I HAVE MADE
customer_reviews.text: Oh man was this worth every penny! Infact I have personally gone out of my way to recommend this to my friends. I am a performer who often doesn't have the time to stand there and iron things so being able to quickly steam something and run out the door makes this product worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Berger

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, leaks if you set the handle down then pick it back up. The leaks hurt like the dickens(duh) but otherwise it does the job that we need it to do
customer_reviews.author: Connor Peoples

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain one bit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steamer after owning a different brand about 6 months ago and haven't had a single problem yet. I don't usually write reviews but I decided since it's such a good little steamer that I'd go ahead and do one this time. It heats up FAST and I have no trouble steaming anything... works like a charm! Plan on buying one for my best friend for his birthday in a few weeks.... he doesn't iron and relies on the dryer for no wrinkles. He's used mine before and loves it, so for this price, he's getting one!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: This is super handy. Easier than ironing
customer_reviews.text: This is super handy. Easier than ironing, especially on delicate fabrics. The upright hanger is a little short and it doesn't lock so wants to roll but for the price is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: K. LaPierre

customer_reviews.title: My advice would be to shell out the extra 30$ for a better quality steamer
customer_reviews.text: After having this steamer for a year I am unhappy with it. For starters it is cheaply made but I guess you get what you pay for. The biggest issue is that is occasionally doesn't work. I turn it on and wait for it to get started, after twenty or so minutes nothing is happening. Long story short I upgraded to a more expensive model and I haven't looked back. My advice would be to shell out the extra 30$ for a better quality steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased! Removes wrinkles in no time!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I hate ironing, but with starting a new job, I wanted to make sure I looked nice and put together. I keep this set up next to my dresser and use it probably 3 or 4 times a week. It heats up quickly and for most of my clothing items, it is a breeze to get out wrinkles. Some fabrics occasionally take a little longer to steam and require me to use the included pad on one side of the fabric while steaming the other, but honestly most cotton and cotton blend items don't require it. I'm glad I made this purchase and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaInPittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Never have to iron again!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a steamer like this for 12 years and have given these as gifts to my family members. They work great. No more ironing needed ever again. Just hang up your item, turn the steamer on and 60 seconds later, run the steamer over the clothes and watch the wrinkles steam away. I do it every night and wake up to wrinke-free clothes ready to wear to work. You can even make seams like an iron if desired. It works on silk as well as denim. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen j

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Use Distilled Water For Best Results
customer_reviews.text: It really does steam up fast, and it does the job far better than any steamer I've had previously. At this price point, I don't think there's any steamer on the market worth more dollar for dollar than this one. I'd recommend to anyone considering a steamer to only use distilled water. Any steamer will eventually fail with tap water, with diminishing returns all the while until it eventually bites the dust. Treat the unit right and it should last many serviceable years of use.
customer_reviews.author: JoeysDad

customer_reviews.title: Better than ironing
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer. I no longer use a regular iron. When used correctly it doesnt spit out water like most are claiming. Which was my concern before purchasing after reading the reviews. It works perfect for me. Also to those complaining that there is no way to empty the water left on the inside bottom of the steamer when removing the water tank probably didn't notice the little knob on the bottom that you unscrew in order to let all the water out left inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: After a month, only creates steam for 30 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 years ago, and still regret it. It works well for about 30 seconds, then it just stops producing steam. The reservoir is full, the switch is on and lit up, and the handle is up high, but it just stops steaming. It's very frustrating when two people need a shirt steamed before a night out, and you have to speed through them to make sure you have enough time to get both done before the steam stops flowing. Other people have complained about this so I know the one I have is not just broken.
customer_reviews.author: Beachy Laura

customer_reviews.title: wish it lasted longer
customer_reviews.text: This product did it's job when it was working which took care of the wrinkles off my clothes. However this product did not last long enough to get my money's worth. It only lasted for about 6 months and it stop producing any steam. The light on the switch still would light on but no steam comes out. I only commented now because I came across this as I'm looking for another steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Mac B Pro

customer_reviews.title: Light is still on, but no steam!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the steamer in 2017. Used it very lightly, mostly in the summer months. I hardly ever used it in the past year, partly because it was winter and partly because of working at home. Now when I turned it on, no steam! I cleaned it with a mixture of vinegar and water. No sediment and still no steam! It still looks like new but I guess it has to be thrown away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steamer for life
customer_reviews.text: Ironing is the worst. I honestly can't stand it; so tedious and time-consuming. Ever since I got this steamer, I have been trying to convert everyone around me. I can skip the dry cleaner and put my good clothes through a light wash and low tumble, then end with a steam treatment. There have been many times where someone will comment on just how few wrinkles are in my clothes and it's a great compliment. Like anything else, just be sure to read the care instructions and use distilled water to avoid buildup. And be sure to clear debris from the brush BEFORE the steam starts rolling. I've gotten singed that way before!
customer_reviews.author: B. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Gets the wrinkles out in many of our different types of clothing; only be careful of the brush on certain delicate articles. The crease pad is grand to have--don't want to have a burned hand or thigh! The wifey suggested the tap with a small mixture of vinegar to prohibit the rust, clog, stains; of course distilled alone will do the job, but the vinegar twist does give the fresh scent on the clothes. Haven't used our brand new iron yet! Get one and see for yourself...
customer_reviews.author: elohist

customer_reviews.title: Works great but steam hose is too short to reach drapes
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly. Wand works well to steam wrinkles out of fabric quickly. Water reservoir is ample for normal projects. Pole is tempting to use to move steamer, but not secure enough so don't use it for that. hose will reach about 6 feet, not high enough to reach upper portion of drapes, but I staged it on a matted platform carefully (wheels make it tricky) and got the job done. I steamed drapes, comforter, shams, and pillows. Very easy to use and released all wrinkles easily. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Handy Lady J

customer_reviews.title: Old version I bought was better. I had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: Old version I bought was better. I had high hopes, but it tends to drip (burning liquid isn't fun) and it's also not weighted well so it tends to lean. That said, it functions enough to get wrinkles out of most of my stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe DC->BXL

customer_reviews.title: my wrinkle lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what took me so long to get a standing fabric steamer. I have used hand-held ones in the past that are always cheap in quality and some have even ruined my clothes or burned me. This one is great! You just have to be a bit careful that you are holding the handle upright so the water doesn't get to you... but other than that I love it. I don't have other models to compare to but this one heats up quickly and steams my clothes efficiently and quickly as well.
customer_reviews.author: miyoun86

product_meta.title: Steamfast SF-407 Fabric Steamer
product_meta.description:
Size:1 PackThe Steamfast SF-407 Fabric Steamer is the effective, reliable steamer that belongs in every laundry room. Its 40-ounce removable water tank provides up to 45 minutes of steam time and is ready to use in 45 seconds for quick touch-ups. Hot steam penetrates deep into fabrics and relaxes fibers, releasing wrinkles faster than ironing and freshening clothes in seconds. The SF-407 is gentle on your most delicate fabrics, yet works equally well on drapes, upholstery and other heavier materials. Strong steam not only freshens fabrics and releases wrinkles, but reduces dust mite allergens, kills germs and bed bugs as well. Less expensive and much safer than dry cleaning, the SF-407 requires no chemicals, making it safe for use around your family and pets.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
IMPORTANT INTERNATIONAL DISCLAIMER: This item is built to meet U.S. voltage requirements and may not function properly when used in conjunction with external devices that alter or convert voltage or frequency of electricity. Improper use or shipping the product outside the U.S. will void all warranties.
feature_bullets: SUPERIOR SUPPORT — When you choose a Steamfast product, you’re investing in superior performance and design that will deliver total satisfaction. If not, we’ll replace it, for 2 years. Supported by a customer service team based in Andover, KS.
QUICK HEAT UP TIME — 40-ounce capacity removable water tank heats up in 45 seconds and provides up to 45 minutes of continuous steam.
100% CHEMICAL-FREE — More effective and gentler on fabrics than ironing for all-natural garment care using the power of steam.
REMOVE WRINKLES AND REFRESH — Removes wrinkles and odors from clothes, linens, curtains, upholstery, and more, without the hassle of dry cleaning.
EQUIPPED FOR THE JOB — Comes equipped with a cool-touch fabric hose, telescopic pole, illuminated power switch, attachable fabric brush, and clothes hook.
SANITIZE SURFACES — Steam kills 99.9% of germs and bacteria.
Built to meet U. S. voltage requirements. Certified, safety-tested, and warrantied for use only in the U. S.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
